skill.name: tool-interface-analysis
skill.description: Analyze tool registration, schema generation, and error feedback mechanisms in agent frameworks. Use when (1) understanding how tools are defined and registered, (2) evaluating schema generation approaches (introspection vs manual), (3) tracing error feedback loops to the LLM, (4) assessing retry and self-correction mechanisms, or (5) comparing tool interfaces across frameworks.
skill.summary: Analyze tool registration, schema generation, and error feedback mechanisms in agent frameworks. Use...
skill.author: Dowwie

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. It provides analysis patterns and documentation for studying tool interfaces in AI agent frameworks. No security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Understanding tool interfaces is critical for AI agent framework design. This skill analyzes how frameworks model, register, and execute tools with proper error handling.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes tool modeling patterns (ABC, Protocol, Decorator, Pydantic)
Documents schema generation methods (introspection, Pydantic, decorator, manual)
Maps tool registration patterns (declarative, registry, discovery, factory)
Evaluates error feedback mechanisms and retry strategies
Catalogs built-in tool categories and implementations
limitations: Requires existing codebase to analyze - no standalone execution
Analysis quality depends on code readability and documentation
May need manual verification for complex framework interactions
Limited to patterns visible in source code, not runtime behavior

use_cases.title: Design Tool Abstraction Layer
use_cases.description: Analyze existing frameworks to design optimal tool interfaces with proper schema generation and error handling

use_cases.title: Compare Agent Frameworks
use_cases.description: Evaluate different approaches to tool modeling, registration, and execution across popular AI frameworks

use_cases.title: Audit Tool Execution Patterns
use_cases.description: Examine error handling, validation, and sandboxing mechanisms in agent tool execution

prompt_templates.title: Basic Tool Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the tool interface patterns in this framework. Focus on how tools are defined, registered, and executed. Include schema generation methods and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Schema Generation Deep Dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the schema generation methods used in this framework versus others. Document the trade-offs between introspection, Pydantic, decorator-based, and manual approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the error feedback mechanisms in this framework. How are errors reported back to the LLM? What retry and self-correction mechanisms exist?

prompt_templates.title: Framework Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare tool interfaces across multiple frameworks. Create a matrix showing modeling patterns, schema generation, registration methods, and error handling strategies.

output_examples.input: Analyze the tool interface patterns in LangChain
output: Tool Modeling: Uses Abstract Base Class pattern with BaseTool
Schema Generation: Pydantic-based with automatic JSON Schema conversion
Registration: Declarative list pattern with explicit tool enumeration
Error Handling: Structured error feedback with ToolResult objects
Built-in Tools: 15+ tools across search, code, file, and API categories

best_practices: Use structured error feedback with actionable suggestions for LLM self-correction
Implement schema validation before tool execution to prevent runtime errors
Design tool abstractions that support both static registration and dynamic discovery
Provide clear documentation of tool parameters and return types for maintainability
anti_patterns: Silent error handling that prevents LLM from understanding tool failures
Manual schema definitions that can drift from implementation
Tight coupling between tools and specific LLM providers
Missing validation that allows malformed arguments to reach tool execution

faq.question: Which frameworks are compatible with this analysis?
faq.answer: Works with any Python-based agent framework including LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen, Pydantic-AI, and custom implementations.

faq.question: What file patterns should I analyze?
faq.answer: Focus on files matching **/tool*.py, **/schema*.py, **/registry*.py, **/executor*.py, and **/builtin*.py patterns.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other analysis skills?
faq.answer: Use after codebase-mapping to identify relevant files. Results feed into comparative-matrix and architecture-synthesis skills.

faq.question: Is the analysis automated or manual?
faq.answer: Provides structured analysis patterns and templates. You apply them to the codebase and document findings following the provided format.

faq.question: What if the framework uses non-standard patterns?
faq.answer: Document any unique patterns found. The templates are flexible and can accommodate custom implementations beyond the common patterns listed.

faq.question: How detailed should the analysis be?
faq.answer: Focus on the core tool abstraction, schema generation method, registration pattern, and error handling. Include code examples and file references.
